plugins.name: C2O - Clutter to Organised
plugins.description:
C2O (Clutter to Organized) is a simple and effective Figma plugin that helps designers automatically arrange frames into a structured layout. If your Figma file feels cluttered, C2O will neatly organize everything in just one click.


‚ú® How It Works:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Rename your frames with a prefix inside square brackets.

Example:

[1a] Login Page (Row 1, Frame A)

[1b] Password Entry (Row 1, Frame B)

[2a] Dashboard (Row 2, Frame A)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Run the plugin and click "Organize Frames".

3Ô∏è‚É£ Your frames will be arranged into clearly structured groups, placed in order from top to bottom.

Frames without the naming pattern will be placed in an "Others" group at the bottom.


üí° Why Use C2O?

Eliminates manual alignment work and saves time.

Keeps designs structured and easy to navigate.

Improves team collaboration by maintaining a clean layout.

Click ‚ÄúTry it out‚Äù and bring order to your Figma files effortlessly! üöÄ

plugins.name: Text binder for AI
plugins.description:
Text Binder for AI

A LLM-optimized plugin that lets you enhance text content with AI while preserving your Figma designs. Built with AI guardrails, this plugin safely extracts, processes, and updates text across multiple frames without breaking layouts or losing design fidelity.


‚ú® Key Features

üéØ AI-Ready Content Extraction

  1. Extract text with reference tags for LLM processing
  2. Maintain exact positioning and styling information
  3. Process multiple frames simultaneously
  4. Built-in prompts and guardrails for AI safety


üîÑ Validated Content Updates

  1. Preview AI-generated changes before applying
  2. Intelligent length validation for layout preservation
  3. Real-time status checks for each text element
  4. Clear warnings for potential layout impacts


üöÄ Getting Started

  1. Select your target frames
  2. Extract text with AI-friendly reference tags
  3. Use any LLM while maintaining the safety tags
  4. Review changes with automatic validation
  5. Apply updates with confidence
plugins.tagline: AI-enhanced, design-protected

plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Jam Session
plugins.description:
Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.

Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.


Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyz


How to use

  1. Start a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.
  2. Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.
  3. Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.


Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.

  1. Keeps the fun alive in workshops
  2. Avoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participants
  3. Gives you control of how submissions appear


Jam Session is in public beta.

A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

accepted.name: dano
accepted.description: i do design and design activities

plugins.tagline: Join FigJam activities from anywhere! Run sessions anybody can join from any device.

plugins.name: SmartTableFill
plugins.description:
SmartTableFill is a GPT-powered plugin designed for intelligent table population with contextual data. Unlike basic data fillers, SmartTableFill analyzes existing content to generate relevant entries, making it ideal for tasks like: creating email addresses based on user names, generating addresses aligned with specified cities, or calculating percentages based on given numbers.


Choose between basic and contextual modes to quickly populate tables for mockups, prototyping, and presentations. Customizable settings allow you to target specific text nodes, saving time on manual entry and bringing a smarter approach to data generation.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly populate tables with smart, contextual data using GPT

plugins.name: Text With Styles
plugins.description:
# Flutter Text Style Inspector


A powerful Figma plugin that bridges the gap between Figma text styles and Flutter's Material Design text theme system. This plugin helps developers and designers maintain consistency between Figma designs and Flutter implementations by automatically mapping Figma text styles to their corresponding Flutter TextTheme properties.


## Features


### Real-time Style Inspection

- Instantly view text style information for any selected text layer

- Live updates as you select different text elements

- Support for multiple text selection with smart duplicate filtering


### Comprehensive Style Information

- Displays the complete Figma text style name

- Shows associated color token information

- Previews the actual text content

- Automatically generates corresponding Flutter TextTheme code


### Smart Flutter Code Generation

- Automatically maps Figma text styles to Flutter's Material Design text theme

- Supports all standard Material text styles:

- Headlines (Large, Medium, Small)

- Titles (Large, Medium, Small)

- Body text (with weight variations)

- Labels (Large, Medium, Small)

- Includes font weight handling for body styles (w400, w500, w600)


### User-Friendly Interface

- Clean, organized display of style information

- Easy-to-copy Flutter code snippets

- Compact, floating UI that stays out of your way

- Simple click-outside-to-close functionality


## How to Use


1. Select any text layer(s) in your Figma design

2. The plugin will automatically display:

- The applied Figma text style

- The color token (if available)

- A preview of the text content

- The equivalent Flutter TextTheme code

3. Copy the generated Flutter code directly into your application


## Best Practices


- Name your Figma text styles to match Material Design conventions for automatic mapping

- Use consistent style names to ensure accurate Flutter code generation

- Apply color styles to text layers for complete token information

- Select multiple text layers to quickly inspect all text styles in a component


Perfect for teams working with both Figma and Flutter, this plugin streamlines the handoff process and ensures design consistency across platforms.
plugins.tagline: Select any layer and get its texts with styles

plugins.name: Mermaid to FigJam
plugins.description:
## ‚ú® New Features


### FigJam ‚Üí Mermaid Conversion

- **Section-based conversion**: Select any FigJam Section and convert all flowchart elements within it to Mermaid code

- **Smart node mapping**: Automatically generates clean, sequential node IDs (A, B, C... AA, AB... for 26+ nodes)

- **Shape recognition**: Correctly identifies rectangles, diamonds, and circles from FigJam shapes

- **Connection preservation**: Maintains all connections with labels and arrow types

- **Large diagram support**: Handles flowcharts with 100+ nodes efficiently


### Enhanced UI/UX

- **Dynamic button states**: FigJam ‚Üí Mermaid button is enabled only when a Section is selected

- **Improved UI layout**: Cleaner interface with Sample Flowchart and Clear links

- **Real-time feedback**: Clear status messages for successful conversions

- **Bilingual support**: Works seamlessly with both English and Japanese text


### Technical Improvements

- **Robust error handling**: Graceful handling of edge cases and missing connections

- **Performance optimizations**: Efficient processing of large diagrams

- **Debug logging**: Comprehensive logging for troubleshooting (in development mode)


## üîÑ Conversion Capabilities


### Mermaid ‚Üí FigJam (Enhanced)

- Automatic Section creation with timestamp

- Optimized layout algorithm with branch/merge point detection

- Smart connector routing to minimize overlaps

- Support for all Mermaid node shapes and connection types


### FigJam ‚Üí Mermaid (New)

- Clean Mermaid code generation

- Preserves flowchart structure and logic

- Handles complex branching and merging patterns

- Maintains connection labels and directionality


## üìã Usage


1. **Mermaid ‚Üí FigJam**: Paste your Mermaid code and click convert

2. **FigJam ‚Üí Mermaid**: Select a Section containing your flowchart and click convert

3. **Sample Flowchart**: Click to insert a sample Mermaid diagram

4. **Clear**: Reset the text area for new input


## üõ†Ô∏è Technical Details


- **Node ID Generation**: Intelligent mapping system supporting unlimited nodes

- **Shape Mapping**: FigJam shapes are correctly interpreted as Mermaid syntax

- **Section Detection**: Automatic detection of selected Sections for conversion

- **Color Scheme**: Light blue nodes (#C2E5FF) with blue connectors (#3DADFF)


## üêõ Bug Fixes


- Fixed node positioning issues within Sections

- Resolved connector overlap problems in complex diagrams

- Corrected shape detection for rounded rectangles

- Fixed text encoding issues for Japanese characters


## üîß Requirements


- FigJam (Figma) desktop or web application

- Sections must be used for FigJam ‚Üí Mermaid conversion


## üöÄ Getting Started


1. Install the plugin in FigJam

2. Try the Sample Flowchart to see the conversion in action

3. Use your own Mermaid code or convert existing FigJam diagrams


---


**Note**: This plugin is designed to work with standard flowchart patterns. Complex FigJam designs with custom shapes or annotations may not convert perfectly to Mermaid syntax.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly convert between Mermaid code and FigJam diagrams. Code to visual,    visual to code.

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
üòå No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on üëá


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


üí¨ Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

‚ô•Ô∏è Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üõü How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ‚ùóÔ∏è).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


‚è≥ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you ü§ó


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üîê Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/‚Ä¶) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. ‚Äì for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üöß Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, ‚Ä¶);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


ü™≥ Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


ü´∂ Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets

  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


‚è≥ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you ü§ó


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üîê Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/‚Ä¶) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. ‚Äì for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üöß Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, ‚Ä¶);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


ü™≥ Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


ü´∂ Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma‚Äôs built-in ‚ÄúSelect Matching Layers‚Äù feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master ‚Üí Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You‚Äôll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: Frame Manager
plugins.description:
A simple but powerful tool for organizing and fixing frames in Figma. Detect duplicates, fix naming issues, and ensure proper dimensions in your design files.

Full Description

Frame Manager helps you maintain clean and well-organized Figma files by providing essential tools for working with frames.

Key Features:

üîç Duplicate Frame Detection & Removal

Instantly find frames with identical names

Option to automatically remove duplicates while keeping one instance

Clean up messy files by eliminating redundant elements

üè∑Ô∏è Frame Name Standardization

Identify frames with non-standard naming conventions

Automatically fix frame names to follow consistent PascalCase format

Enforce naming consistency across your design system

üìè Size Optimization

Find frames with dimensions not divisible by 2

Fix frame sizes to ensure clean rendering on various displays

Find frames with non-power-of-2 dimensions for texture optimization

How It Works

Install the plugin and run it from the Plugins menu

Select the feature you need from the simple, intuitive interface

Get instant feedback as the plugin detects issues or fixes problems

Enjoy a cleaner, more organized Figma file

Perfect For

Design teams working on large files

Designers preparing assets for developers

Anyone who wants to maintain consistent naming and sizing in their designs

Technical Details

Lightweight and fast - analyzes your file without lag

Non-destructive - always gives you control over changes

Works with any Figma file containing frames

Maintain better design hygiene and save hours of manual cleanup with Frame Manager!


2025 - WildCard Studios - Art Department

Solution : Use this tool to collapse alternative pages in the main workflow, displaying only the first option initially. After presenting the main flow, click a toggle button to expand all pages for detailed discussions
plugins.tagline: Toggle Frame show/hide

plugins.name: Stockpress
plugins.description:
About

Welcome to the Stockpress plugin for Figma, where you can quickly find and add files from your Stockpress workspace to your Figma designs. Once ready, export Frames and images back to Stockpress - complete with Frame URLs for easy access to working files!


What is Stockpress?

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management system‚Äìfor everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co
plugins.tagline: Add files from your Stockpress workspace to your design and export Figma assets back once ready

plugins.name: Content Kit
plugins.description: his Figma plugin allows designers to quickly generate Nigerian-themed content directly within their projects, saving time and enhancing local relevance. The plugin includes customizable templates, authentic text content (e.g., Yoruba proverbs, Pidgin phrases, or local idioms), cultural icons, and elements inspired by Nigeria‚Äôs rich diversity. Whether designing for digital products, branding, or social media, the plugin ensures an authentic touch, fostering deeper connections with Nigerian audiences. Users can tweak settings to suit various languages, regions, and styles, making it a versatile tool for creative professionals.
plugins.tagline: Generate Nigerian names and more!

plugins.name: Side note
plugins.description:
Meet Side Note, your minimalist companion for organizing thoughts, ideas, and to-dos in style. Side Note is designed for simplicity, focus, and seamless integration with your creative workflow. Whether you're jotting down quick ideas or capturing important notes, Side Note keeps everything neat and accessible.


Key Features:


  1. Customizable Notes: Add titles, content, and importance labels to make each note unique.
  2. Smart Sizing: Flexible vertical layouts with precise padding for a polished design.
  3. Intuitive Interface: Clean, modern UI for a distraction-free note-taking experience.
  4. Important Labeling: Highlight key notes with an elegant "Important" tag for quick prioritization.
  5. Effortless Integration: Built for seamless use within Figma, perfect for designers on the go.
plugins.tagline: Quick Notes, Seamless Workflow.

plugins.name: skinnerplugin
plugins.description:
Bring your CSS themes to life effortlessly with Skinner. This plugin empowers designers to create, manage, and apply consistent styles across all elements of their Figma projects with ease. By simply providing a CSS theme, Skinner instantly generates paint styles for backgrounds, text, and accents, enabling a streamlined and cohesive design workflow.


With Skinner, you can:


Generate and update styles in seconds.

Maintain a consistent design aesthetic across your projects.

Easily switch between different color themes and accents for versatile design needs.

Whether you‚Äôre designing for web, mobile, or any digital interface, Skinner ensures that your styles are always organized, professional, and ready for use.


Simplify. Style. Create. With Skinner.
plugins.tagline: Skinner - Seamless Style Generation for Figma

plugins.name: RTS CopyBookCreator
plugins.description:
The plugin pulls all texts from selected frames and creates a CSV-file. The CSV will have 4 columns to help you organize your copybook. These columns are: Name of the Frame, Name of the Group, Name of the Text-Style, Text. If you organize your designs accordingly, you'll get a neatly structured Copybook.


Important: The plugin uses semicolons as delimiter, so that Excel can show the CSV properly.
plugins.tagline: Pulls all texts from your figma designs and creates a csv file.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin does not require network access.

109546.release_notes:
Version 2.0.0 Updates:
- Added support for multiple independent counters
- Use {n1}, {n2}, {n3} etc. for different number sequences
- All counters increment automatically
- Maintained backward compatibility with {n} syntax
- Improved error handling and performance
